subject: Science
title: Antibiotic-Resistant Bacteria
description: A micro-lesson that makes Antibiotic-Resistant Bacteria usable.

hook.text: Bacteria are evolving resistance to our best drugs â€” and they're winning.

buildup.text: When you take antibiotics, most bacteria die. But a few with resistant mutations survive.

discovery.text: Those survivors multiply. Soon, the entire population is resistant. The drug stops working.

twist.text: MRSA and other superbugs kill over a million people per year â€” more than malaria.

climax.text: Bacteria evolve in hours. New drugs take years to develop. We're losing the arms race.

punchline.text: Evolution isn't ancient history. Bacteria are doing it in your body right now.

quiz.question: How do bacteria become antibiotic-resistant?
options: Resistant mutants survive and multiply after others die
They absorb the drug and use it for energy
Antibiotics cause bacteria to mutate on purpose
